bow: how do you manage going out for appointments amp errands with newborn first time mom looking for advice on how to manage newborn and heading outside for appointments and errands ve done by my baby schedule make sure that he fed and newly diapered and then head out not by my baby schedule head out when you need to pray that he does have meltdown in the car seat or get blowout when you need to get something done at certain time any pro tips for me my baby is now weeks old and definitely have anxiety about heading out with the little guy update thanks for all the posts and replies have appointments scheduled for monday tuesday and wednesday so it ll be good practice for me to put your advice to use just do what you can when you can if you know that you ve got to run to the store or whatever go as soon as you ve finished feeding and changed his diaper but avoid stressing yourself out to much if at all possible the more stressed you become the harder it will be to keep baby calm if there is time where you just have to go out you just do the best you can with what you have haha am still trying to figure this out with my five month old mostly try not to schedule things during nap time and try to be flexible the rest of the time ummm you just do it sorry am just confused know you re first time mom but was also new mom nearly 14 months ago and my husband was deployed then and is again you do the best you can new diaper fed head out if the baby gets hungry again feed them in the back seat assuming you re breast feeding or have bottles of warm water ready and throw in formula have diapers and wipes ready and change them on the seat of your car or in bathroom at store if they have meltdown that fine that what babies do if they have blow out explosive diaper that why you bring an extra set of clothes believe me had plenty of explosive diapers at stores or while out and you just deal with them that about the best advice can give you ca just not live your life and be shut in because you have baby they will learn to adapt to your needs too hope that helped edit can tell this came across as bitchy however am honestly just confused about the post itself guess can be down voted to oblivion for having genuine confusion on this but oh well babies do come with manuals at least mine did you just learn what they need and adapt to it and they adapt to what you need as well when my children were tiny baby carrier sling was really helpful they do take little time to get comfortable with but you can let your little one sleep in it while you re at the grocery store or whatnot you can nurse them in it you can bottlefeed them in it they can see things and be entertained in it they are close to you and usually much more happy also having the stroller available to snap their car seat into when they were asleep when we arrived packing up the diaper bag with anything might possibly need everything takes twice as long to do with an infant this holds true for toddlers as well my year old does slow me down very much anymore at least and if you plan that into your timetable and expect it that can help reduce stress my kids are at their best in the morning at every age who is guess so try to go out as early as possible stores are less crowded so errands are faster too keep sling in my diaper bag at all times because it will nearly always stop meltdown in its tracks regardless of the cause and then my hands are free enough to still finish up bring anything else you migh need like pacifier when they are little older start bringing small toy they do normally get to play with bottle with little water in it my breastfed boys would take bottle but were intrigued by this and snack the key is to have something distracting enough to keep them occupied even if they are unhappy two words baby wearing it was the only way to get things done with child under they go into the car seat if we had to drive anywhere but as soon as we had to get out and do something go somewhere into the bjorn they went they would ether be happily content looking around being snuggled by mom or dad or would go to sleep at weeks your babe is still on high demand of eating and diaper changes but that what well loaded diaper bag are for first time parenting is rough but soon enough you ll get the hang of being able to change even the worst diapers in minute flat just make sure you have wipeable changing pad or receiving blanket as cheaper method since those can be washed fistful of clean diapers travel bag of wipes and couple bottles if you re bottle feeding we ve all been there we ve all had to take our babies out it just something that right is probably still feeling strange and foreign to you but will be second nature soon enough ll never forget with my first was sure how to ride bus with her do bring the car seat the stroller what do do looking back it kinda funny but at the time thought for sure was going to screw it up was out and about with my daughter when she was days old life does stop it adjusts agree with you you just deal with it now can travel at any point in the day armed with bottle and snacks she now months old and life is good she also sleeps through anything because did always have the time to wait for her first nap of the day to happen she sleeps just fine in her stroller or carseat if she needs nap you just make it work and keep going do think there are any special protips except to have your supplies ready extra set of clothes diapers wipes formula milk and do go if your baby is already overtired newborns are the easy ones to go out with but unfortunately you do realize that until they re older as others have said just relax and do it and do rush you will learn what works with your baby and only absolute asshole would completely understand that sometimes babies fuss being aware that you will not keep to schedule if you try to schedule it just does seem to happen left myself plenty of time and wore him or used carrier getting out was the thing that kept me sane also if was too tired that day oh well stay home also made sure to have plenty of supplies you do have to bog yourself down carrying them but keeping extra clothes and diapers in the car is lifesaver also keep extra clothes for you nothing worse than smelling like puke all day in short just go and know it could take 10 minutes or hours and try not to worry about it did really get into babywearing until my second was born was amazed at how much could get done with him in carrier try to leave bit earlier than you usually would when first had my daughter we were at the doctor office 30 minutes before the appointment this way if she needed to be fed or changed we were rushing we planned out our route before we left because when we were out we decided to do all of our running around then instead of making multiple trips in one day we got everything ready to go the night before we had her outfit that she was going to wear laid out with fresh diaper and wipes we had her diaper bag packed with more diapers than we ever need an extra set of clothes an extra blanket and extra pair of shoes when was breastfeeding we had bottle of pumped milk with us in case we were driving this way one of us could sit in the back with her and feed her in her car seat when was unable to breastfeed was producing enough milk we always had extra bottles can of formula and gallon of water with us the main thing is to try and relax if your baby starts having meltdown in the car pull over this is where leaving early saved us and try to calm them down we also kept sling with us in case she got fussy in stores and such which never became an issue with us but we had it just in case just remember other parents will usually be sympathetic those who are do matter you probably wo ever see judgmental people in stores ever again they can get over themselves have diaper bag stocked plenty of bottles diapers and couple changes of clothes toy or two when they are interested in that sort of thing if your baby is still small carry them in carseat and everything is much more manageable am having harder time since do not use the bucket carseat any more and when my little one gets tired she falls over in cart bring the stroller or moby at all times just be prepared for whatever they will need and go do what you have to do dirty diapers happen and babies get hungry just help them and continue what you are doing the more you go out the easier it will be also having helper with you makes it much easier if possible my daughter is weeks and we get out quite regularly otherwise would go crazy at home where possible make sure she been fed and changed just before going out that way she less likely to be cranky in the car she usually falls asleep as soon as we start driving or if she being pushed in the pram so she pretty easy to take out just make sure you re organised with spare clothes nappies wipes and food if needed and you ll be fine leave way earlier than you think you need to carry moby wrap at all times be comfortable with feeding him anywhere carry at least one extra outfit it not necessary but usually have changing pad with me so do have to put baby down on nasty baby changing table also ve changed her in the car do know how many times usually have blanket with me ive changed her on the grass in the middle of the park before too just be prepared have backpack instead of diaper bag basically just do what you need to do there is no way to get around baby unpredictable nature sometimes the errands go smoothly and nothing happens sometimes the kid has huge screaming fit or pukes on everything or fills their sleepers with poop from neck to toes and sometimes it in between carry diaper bag with clothes diapering supplies new blankets plastic bags and whatever else you think you might need so you ll be ready for anything and just go do what you need to do there no way to prevent things from happening embrace the chaos you ll be fine my daughter is now months old what did and still do is get everything ready that need feed her change her diaper and get her into her jacket and go she has been fully satisfied before we go out when she was new new she could go out at nap time and sleep through almost anything now that she is older she is too aware to nap when am out so the carrier is my saviour as she is not fan of the stroller just want to highlight few things others have said here bring extra of everything if you can go when baby is fed changed and not overtired go with the flow do let things get to you be flexible really that all you can do also hear baby wearing helps lot but that can be different for everyone most importantly remember that this is the easy time just had the worst experience in wal mart with my two year old and long for the days when he was newborn and would just sleep the whole time it will get much harder before it gets easier so try not to stress too much at this point yep oh my god did ever sing the praises of my ring sling when discovered it around weeks went from avoiding every trip to relishing going out and about nursing in it in public was breeze built in cover and almost hands free and felt so incredibly liberated that my spirits were through the roof never had to deal with blowouts though my boy pooped about four times day at that stage so never too huge sorry that you re being downvoted for not coddling the op had the same types of anxiety issues about going out that op did but had to buck up and go because as single mom there was anyone around to run my errands for me baby screeched up and down the aisles of the grocery store was so embarrassed by the crying but then realized that most people have children and they more than understand this is off topic but absolutely love your flair if you breast feed have few bottles prepped and ready if not make sure you have bottle or ready used to keep bottle of water in the diaper bag you can buy them in 8oz sizes and bottle with the measured out formula ready to mix get toy or that will hang from the baby carrier my son loved set of jingly squirrels found at target and cow that would vibrate and bounce some beads in its belly when string was pulled try and work around the kid my son did better in the morning so would try and get as much done before noon or so as could sometimes that meant days of errands instead of one try and do them all in one day or designate day or as errand day used to try and get everything done on wednesdays avoided the have to have it done first of the week crowd as well as the waited till the last minute to have it done this week crowd whenever possible use cart park next to cart corrals it might mean walking bit farther but could pull cart out right next to my car and put the carrier in the cart when he was bigger and could ride without his carrier bought cart cover they re great to protect against cold hot seats and barrier for germs at cold season snacks and couple pacifiers when that time comes also just know sometimes it not going to work prioritize what you re willing to do with screaming kid do those things and try again later for the rest second the extra supplies suggestion and will add two diaper bags suggestion we have an official bag in our car with double supplies clothes etc always be prepared then diaper roll up in my purse the diaper roll up has only the most basic supplies so it is easy to carry but the scout bag has everything we could need and can also be carried into store in pinch edit rollup example http www amazon com the first years deluxe diapering dp b003zk5o4y ref=pd cp ba came here to say this too there is no surefire way of ensure that it will go smoothly every single time best thing to do is just try to be prepared give yourself extra time to get everything ready do as much as you can before you leave feeding changing and then hope for the best and then just laugh when it does go off without hitch because it wo my baby used to cry all the damn time at weeks being new mom was terrified of going out with her what kept her calm enough to eventually go to sleep was swaddling the ones by summer infant http www summerinfant com products nursery swaddle me speciality blankets swaddleme swaddleme three pack aspx have slit in the back so you can buckle them in the carseat you have to lay the swaddle in the car seat and pull through the buckles put baby in and then wrap swaddle do that and head out the door the car ride would usually put her to sleep and the swaddle helped her to stay asleep while ran my errands here my lo asleep http imgur com fplfa jpg while at target also make sure diaper bag is packed with everything and then some like extra clothes have everything ready so that after you fed and change the baby you can head right out the door time is of the essence white noise helps too so download an app for your phone if you have already just remind myself that everything does not have to be perfect if am 10 15 minutes late to an appointment its not the end of the world plan out my errands every sunday night for the entire week that way if do have time to get to one no big deal and can push it back until another day do let your errands and chores own you plan take charge and attack them one at time find looking at things have to do one at time makes things much more manageable in my head schedule all appointments for when your baby will be awake already feed and diaper before leaving went out weekly when my twins were little and still do baby wearing did work for me because of back issues so just had decent double stroller my daughter refused to be put in carrier from the start she also hated being swaddled and would scream until you undid the blankets or would undo them herself at six months she refuses to use blanket she weird just carried her around in her carseat lot just go have change of clothes plenty of diapers wipes cream snacks for you etc and go you ca be sure there wo be blowout could happen at any time it be nice if he got it over with with just enough time for you to clean him up before you leave the house but waiting for it just means you ll spend lot of time sitting around instead of living the more you go out the more you ll get used to it and the more relaxed you ll be practice if you have to go out every day if only for little walk or to the grocery store used to take my daughter to starbucks few days week get coffee or tea and nurse her and we leave when she started to get fussy also they just cry in the car they want you but they ca see you and you re not holding them so they cry used to take little side trips down residential streets and alternate pressing firmly on gas and brake pedals was just waiting for cop to pull me over hear the baby cry as he came up to the car and then just tell me nevermind carry on one of the things that made newborn outings good for me was feeding her before we left reserved good hour to hour and 15 minutes before go time to just sit with her and nurse her into giddy oblivion always pack the diaper bag in advance if we are going out in the morning the bag is packed the night before also used my moby wrap to snuggle her close so she could snooze and listen to my heartbeat and my voice through my chest this was especially useful at parties your post is funny to me because it is totally how feel after three kids however when my first was born was like op was the youngest in my family and never really babysat for babies my son diaper was the first ever changed so going out by myself with baby in tow was big deal started off with little trips walks around the block or drive to the grocery store were great to start you will find way op right did mean it as rude had my little boy with my husband gone on deployment we live in washington state and have no family for 500 miles had one friend that took pics but left soon after literally just had to figure it out but eventually you ca just plan around the baby naps or feedings you have to just do what you got ta do even with 14 month old now that he drinks actual cows milk it is difficult because he likes it slightly warm and obviously do carry jug of milk with me in the car we just figure it out honestly there have been times had too much stuff with me in preparation and other times did being enough it all just learning process we have second on the way and wo know what the gender is until we have the baby so if its girl we will be learning all over again and each kid is so different my first was easy going my second was picky and fussy and my third is dream baby no matter what you got ta do what you got ta do it not going to stay this hard you re going to find what works for you and pretty soon you ll be pro in the meantime just keep trying things the posts that mention baby wearing are right on several people also mentioned keeping extra of everything in the car kept box in the back of the car with extra of all diapering supplies plus full outfit for me and for baby even though there was also full baby outfit in the diaper bag also put full container of wipes some plastic bags and couple of bath towels in the box there will come time when you re glad you have them practically try to do most of your shopping at one place for awhile like target or walmart it worth compromising on favorite brands if you can just be done in one stop if anyone in your area does grocery delivery that can be awesome when your baby is really small changing rooms in any department store including target and walmart can be quiet refuge if you need to comfort the baby want to breast feed in private or just need minute to collect yourself with cranky little one tell the attendant you like to feed the baby and they ll set you up with room ve never had single person refuse or even look at me funny there also lot of truth from the gal who said you ve just got to do it that true you just power on and learn more each day then day comes when you think so have this deleted aww that is sweet of your husband talking to the baby like that and thank you we are getting used to it now his ship is one of the unfortunate ones that had back to back deployments so he missed the first months of our sons life as well as all first holidays and all second major holidays but second baby is supposed to be born when he home so hopefully and do forget it kinda scary now but my son will be months next week and got this whole mom thing down pat go pretty much everywhere by myself and if he poops everywhere or is fussy just deal with it no one really cares and if they did well to bad for them would try to go out when baby is ready for nap that way he ll sleep in the car or even right after nap so you do need to worry about waking him up as you get in and out of the car if baby loves music try playing that while you re in the car figure out what he likes to listen to or just try different things this works for our daughter also always be prepared know others have already said it but make sure you pack everything you may need before you head out also another random tip if you re ever out somewhere and you need to change baby look for family restroom before the women some places only have the changing table in the family rr for whatever reason never wore my son we loved the snap and go not too expensive can find it on craigslist but it awesome for those heavy car seats ve heard great things about the moby wrap too you just have to learn your kid some babies cry no matter what you do some are super care free just try to relax they re like dogs they sense panic lol good luck how did you bring your baby on the bus this soooo much did wear my first and that was huge mistake with my son just put him in my ergo carrier and he would sleep and eat the whole time so much easier than when would drag stroller into changing room at target to feed my daughter seriously newborns are the least of your worries am just finding this out after having my 2nd child weeks ago its the toddlers that are the challenge have found baby wearing to be great help they tend to fall asleep while being worn use an ergo or other back friendly baby carrier hear what you re saying yes ergo is great for breastfeeding on the fly and it works great for carrying on your back too would add change of clothes and gallon ziplock or two for dirty diapers and or clothes to the diaper wipes changing pad necessities also wallet phone and camera because you never know when those moments will happen and you ll wish you taken picture the bare necessities for hour trip can be crammed into medium sized purse around x1 my sleepywrap was lifesaver could practically go anywhere anytime well not really but could at least do laundry with her very easily and the dishes once or twice still babywear while grocery shopping tho now we ve upgraded to the ergo newborns are the easy ones to go out with as the mom of and year old and newborn can vouch for this get good sling or carrier if you re nursing invest in nursing cover bring diapers wipes change of clothes and bibs or burp cloths and just do stress if the baby gets hungry grab your cover and fees him if he fussy put him in the sling and rock him little and do worry about what anyone else thinks most people you will encounter understand that babies cry and fuss ended up using the bjorn baby carrier did even think about it until the friend who gifted it to me was like duh that why gave it to you and it made it so much easier wore my first until she was able to walk on her own and then got one of the dreaded leash packs imo it must have for city living if you are going anywhere with toddler who wants to walk and easy to carry combi stroller for when she wanted break from walking nice because they are far more sturdy than umbrella stroller but lightweight enough and had carrying strap that could stow it under the bus seat if need be ditched the diaper bags by the time baby came along for small leather laptop carry all found it was way easier to clean out because sooner or later your bag is going to get nasty from spilled bottles and forgotten diapers not to mention sippy cuts and crushed cheerios which was nice because could use it as my everyday bag even when did have the kids in tow just took out the diapers and wipes and was on my way plus my husband did feel completely silly carrying it around when he was in charge of the kids for the day my arms ache just thinking about it but know how fickle babies can be my first was only happy swaddled as tight as can be or in the bjorn no other wrap or sling would do and my second luckily was easy going baby and did care about anything two extra sets of clothes level diapers exist and can happen more than once in an outing and give yourself big margin between commitments if you do have to hurry you can relax and care for your baby as he needs it that is true for toddlers and older too allowing margin really helps you keep your calm at 17 months mine still kicks all the blankets off it probably why they make such warm pajamas for kids babywearing does lot to keep babies calm just had the ergo now the beco on the front and my small backpack on my back with small packet of wipes nappies my take everywhere muslin and change of clothes that was it now add some babyfood sachets and water cup to the mix but it still pretty light keep it clean easily you put the nappies and wipes into small bag and then any foodstuffs into another bag waterproof spongebag style bag can be great or actually use little cloth bag at the moment easy to wash if anything gets on it ve always been mystfied by friends loading up prams and pushchairs with these vast nappy bags and multiple bags of things and then they rummage around for ages and often ca even find do even have what they need my ergo was dream could go shopping be out with friends for hours in it and she would sleep feed be taken out for quick nappy change rinse repeat you do get bit of sore back sometimes but the more you do it the more your strength grows with their weight once they re old enough to go on your back for which recommend beco butterfly just so much easier to do that with though not good for early breastfeeding it like they halve in weight again started taking my girl to get groceries every week when she was still really little for me it was case of practice makes perfect just be ready to abandon ship if you have to if have one regret it that did learn this soon enough my son wanted to be held constantly and wanted to hold him did not get much done tried bjorn did like his head against the plastic pieces and ring sling he hated it later learned about all of the other baby wearing options if have another baby will definitely have moby wrap and an ergo good luck also when finally bought myself bebe aulait nursing cover it was incredibly liberating to be able to comfortably nurse everywhere yes backpack for diaper bag so much easier to bend and carry baby without something on your shoulder had this same problem friend gave me bjorn but it gave me horrible back pain my daughter would scream bloody murder every time put her in sling the wrap worked great but hated trying to put it on in parking lot when was out shopping so ended up only using it at home got the ergo when my daughter was for family hike when our son was born he practically lived in it for the first two months even wore him to the park to workout with some of my friends try to keep your time out short and sweet have plan before you leave so you do waste time and have to leave before you ve done everything you wanted to try to go out while he sleeping you can get lot more done dress as comfortably as possible leggings and nursing top was my uniform for months good luck you ll be fine agreed getting out of the house is so important to make new mom feel like real person again obviously there are exhausting overwhelming days when it just does happen but do the best you can leave the house prepared and enjoy some time outside my son has always enjoyed being outside himself he gets cranky when he cooped up for too long have very big baby and he gets too hot hates the carrier for newborns will try again at three months with an outward facing but for now he really dislikes them was so excited to get one and have had no luck with it if this happens to you got stroller with very cool bassinet attachment he sleeps everywhere and take public transit lot so he just relaxes in bassinet much better than those uncomfortable looking car seat travel systems he can scooch around and we also use the bassinet for daytime naps in the house she is about months old now and sits up unsupported really well so mostly just put her in her stroller these days things to do next time with the next baby suppose
